author: agnxsh
content: received a few data columns of most likely an orphaned block from `teku-geth-3` while syncing slot at `95392`, it says the data columns block header didn't match the actual block header, are you guys storing data columns for blocks that are non-canonical as well? <@425907307621122049>

author: agnxsh
content:
> are you guys storing data columns for blocks are the non-canonical as well?
if so then it's normal

author: agnxsh
content:
> The following data column sidecars, where they exist, MUST be sent in consecutive (slot, index) order.

this is NOT enforced in Nimbus atm

author: agnxsh
content:
https://dora.peerdas-devnet-3.ethpandaops.io/slot/0x2fbaab021d22d69d351a467659923285df0a7981260cfa4e5d9e95f367595571

it's actually ok, `95392` was an orphaned block proposed by `lighthouse-geth-3`

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
we store both canonical and non-canonical
we probably shouldn't return non-canonical in byRange response, but it's ok to respond with it in byRoot

author: dmitriishmatko
content: in byRange it's a bug I think
